recordTypes.name: Sprinkler System Repair
recordTypes.description: This permit allows for sprinkler repair, installation etc.  If you are disabling a sprinkler system, for any reason, this permit and permission is required by law.

recordTypes.name: Certificate of Municipal Lien Request
recordTypes.description: Please allow up to 10 business days for processing.

recordTypes.name: Facilities Use Application
recordTypes.description: This form is a request to use Recreation facilities, all applicants are required to review additional permits required through the Community Development Department at the Town Hall.

recordTypes.name: Proclamations, Letters of Support or Appreciation
Resident Transfer Station Sticker 2026
recordTypes.description:
Stickers for access to the Provincetown Transfer Station. 
Stickers are good from January- December.

recordTypes.name: ACO Septic Inspection
recordTypes.description: Licensed Septic Inspectors: Use this application to report on properties already under a Provincetown Board of Health 'Administrative Consent Order' (ACO) as a status update, or for systems that fail Title 5 or local regulations, to request an ACO.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Board of Appeals
recordTypes.description: Special Permits, Appeals, or Variances

recordTypes.name: Special Permit/Site Plan Review by Special Permit
Certification of Compliance (Smoke)
recordTypes.description: The Certification of Compliance verifies that the smoke/Carbon Monoxide alarms in a building or residence meet the requirements and is necessary during property sales or transfers to ensure the smoke alarms are properly installed and functioning.

recordTypes.name: Title 5 Official Inspection Report Filing
recordTypes.description: Licensed Septic Inspectors: Use this application to report on properties that have a stamped, engineered sewage disposal system design plan of record only.

recordTypes.name: Minor Modification - Zoning Board of Appeals
Traffic Hearing Application
recordTypes.description: Now accepting applications for the 2025 Traffic Hearing. Please fill out the application and submit by September 29th, 2025. Please note that applicants must secure a certified abutter's list from the Assessor's Office for a fee of $25.00 (abutters to abutters within 300 feet). Feel free to reach out with any questions!

recordTypes.name: Fire Alarm Test Report
recordTypes.description: A Fire Alarm Test Report is a report that ensures that all fire alarm systems are functioning as intended and any issues are addressed promptly.  Alarm Companies and Electricians can also submit a form via email directly to the Fire Department.   This form and application is only intended for personnel who perform tests but do not have access to the standard form we use or their own forms.

recordTypes.name: Fire & Medical Records Request
recordTypes.description: This is a request for records related to any Fire response and/or EMS response in the Town of Provincetown.  Only authorized individuals will be allowed to access these reports (ie: Applicant and Fire/Rescue Staff).  For medical report requests specifically, these are governed Federally (HIPAA) and the State and as such, there are strict parameters for which we need to oblige to protect the patient.

recordTypes.name: Entertainment Licenses
recordTypes.description: Weekday and Sunday Entertainment Application

recordTypes.name: Gas Storage Tank(s) Installation
recordTypes.description: The installation of gas storage tanks requires a permit from the Provincetown Fire Department for the inspection of the Tank Portion. Additionally, a Gas Permit from the building department is  also required.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit - Express
recordTypes.description: Roofing, Siding,  Insulation or Sheds.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit - Tent
recordTypes.description: Tents

recordTypes.name: Oil Burner/Tank Installation/Removal Permit
recordTypes.description: A permit is required for the installation, maintenance, operation and/or removal of oil-burning equipment; including the burner and/or tank.

recordTypes.name: Employment-Tourism Department
recordTypes.description: Assistant Director of Tourism

recordTypes.name: Storage  of Flammable/Combustible Permit
recordTypes.description: Storage of Flammable/Combustible Permit is required for businesses and individuals managing the storage of flammable or combustible liquids.

recordTypes.name: Private Road Name Change
recordTypes.description: Procedure for Re-naming a Private Road

recordTypes.name: Vital Records Request
recordTypes.description: Birth/Death/Marriage

recordTypes.name: Trench & Road Opening Permit
recordTypes.description: Pursuant to G.L. c. 82A §1 and 520 CMR 7.00 et seq. (as amended)

recordTypes.name: Gas Permit
recordTypes.description: Inspector will review and issue permits within 24-48 hours moving forward.

recordTypes.name: Plumbing Permit
recordTypes.description: Inspector will review and issue permits within 24-48 hours moving forward.

recordTypes.name: Tank Truck Inspection
recordTypes.description: A truck inspection permit is required for transport vehicles that are used in the transportation of combustible liquids.

recordTypes.name: Abbreviated Notice of Resource Area Delineation - ANRAD
Board & Committee Member Applications
recordTypes.description: Want to Serve on a Town Board?  If you'd like to see what vacancies are open – https://www.provincetown-ma.gov/259/General-Information.

recordTypes.name: Hot Works Permit
recordTypes.description: A hot works permit is required when performing operations like welding, cutting, brazing, or other activities that produce heat, sparks, or flames which can potentially trigger a fire.

recordTypes.name: Sprinkler System
recordTypes.description: This permit is required when a sprinkler system is installed, altered, extended, dismantled or reconfigured.    Please allow up to 10 (ten) days for Fire Department review prior to issuance of the permit. You must be a licensed professional to apply for this permit.

recordTypes.name: Propane Gas Cylinder Exchange
recordTypes.description: A permit is required for propane gas cylinder exchange.

recordTypes.name: Underground Tank Removal
recordTypes.description: An underground tank removal permit is necessary when you plan to remove an underground storage tank (UST), particularly those storing flammable or combustible liquids.

recordTypes.name: Application to Appear Before Board of Health
Flammables/Explosives (FP-5) Registration
recordTypes.description: The Flammables/Explosives (FP-5) Registration is related to the oversight and control of the storage and handling of flammable or explosive materials.

recordTypes.name: Parking Lot
recordTypes.description: Year-round Parking Lot License

recordTypes.name: Wastewater Professionals: Septic Installer, Septage Hauler, Sewer Connector Permits
Well Construction
recordTypes.description:
Per Board of Health policy for the sequence of private irrigation well permit application steps:
•As a pre-requisite to any private well new permit applications, a plumbing permit to install a dual-check backflow preventer on the water service  must be completed. Upon the final plumbing permit inspection sign-off verifying the dual-check valve , an application an irrigation well may be issued.

recordTypes.name: Sewer Connection Request
recordTypes.description: Application by Licensed  Professional Only

recordTypes.name: Varianced Grease Management Plan Request for W&S Approval

categories.name: Building
categories.content: The primary function of the Building Department is to enforce 780 Code of Massachusetts Regulations (CMR), the Massachusetts State Building Code, 9th Edition & 10th Edition, and the various codes referenced there

categories.name: Licensing
categories.content:
Licensing

The Provincetown Licensing Board is responsible for issuing licenses and for enforcing rules, regulations, and state laws. Licenses and permits issued by the Board include: alcohol (annual, seasonal, and one-days), common victualer, lodging, retail shop, parking lot, entertainment, pedicab, livery/taxi, and more. Lodging license applications are under the Health category, however. Please note that application fees

categories.name: Rental Certificates
categories.content:
VIEW: Health Regulation, Habitations for Rent

categories.name: Health
categories.content:
The Provincetown Health Department, as agents of the Provincetown Board of Health, performs many important functions relative to the protection of public health, the promotion of sanitary living conditions, and the protection of the environment from damage and pollution.

categories.name: Water Department
categories.content:
The Water Department is responsible for providing its customers with safe, high quality drinking water adhering to U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) and Massachusetts Department of Environmental Protection (MassDEP) drinking water regulations.

Provincetown Water Department Rules and Regulations: Section 2.5- Availability of Municipal Water. Application will be accepted for review subject to there being an existing municipal water main in a Town-owned street or right-of

categories.name: Community Development
categories.content:
Growth Management Permit is required for all new construction, including new structures and enlargement, alteration or renovation of existing structures, to all new uses, and to all expansions, changes, or alterations of existing uses, which will result in an increase, no change, or a decrease in Title 5 Design Flow as determined by the Health Agent.

Economic Development Permit allows you to apply for additional wastewater design flow gallons to grow yo

categories.name: Town Clerk
categories.content: The Town Clerk acts as the Town's chief election official, registrar of vital statistics (births, marriages, and deaths), keeper of public records, recording officer, licensing officer and Burial Agent/Cemetery Lot Sales.

categories.name: Public Way
categories.content:
GENERAL BYLAWS

11-6. Public ways

11-6-1. Excavation of public ways. No person shall break or dig up the ground or surface of a town or public way or sidewalk without express permission from the Commissioner of Public Safety or his delegate, who shall require a performance bond sufficient to guarantee restoration of the street following excavation by a private contractor. Upon neglect or violation of any duty imposed under this bylaw, such work may

categories.content: Licensed Wastewater Professionals making sewer connections are required to apply at least 2 business days ahead of actual field work. Licensee must submit this application to document the proper abandonment of on-site disposal system and receive permission to proceed.
